docs.lead_paragraph: When 18 students started twitching, parents suspected the environment. The answer turned out to be much more complex.

headline.seo: The Mystery of 18 Twitching Teenagers in Le Roy
headline.main: What Happened to the Girls in Le Roy
headline.print_headline: What Happened to the Girls in Le Roy

docs.abstract: Mysterious ailment afflicting 18 students in Le Roy, NY, leads parents to suspect the environment was responsible for children's odd symptoms, like uncontrollable twitching and muscle spasms; repeated tests of both the environment and children result in something far more complex; illness is a combination of conversion disorder, in which stress is subconsciously converted into physical symptoms, and mass psychogenic illness, both of which are poorly understood.
docs.snippet: When 18 students started twitching, parents suspected the environment. The answer turned out to be much more complex.

docs.lead_paragraph: Baby boomers say they want to stay in the work force past retirement age, a time that will coincide with increases in certain taxes and may cut into Social Security benefits.

headline.seo: Tax Changes Ahead Call for Planning Now
headline.main: With Tax Changes Near, ‘You Can’t Wait to Plan’
headline.print_headline: With Tax Changes Near, ‘You Can’t Wait to Plan’

docs.abstract: Financial advisers say that more than ever, people who are considering staying in the work force past retirement age need a life plan to account for living expenses, health, tax, investment and estate issues; urgency is compounded by significant tax changes scheduled to take effect in 2013.
docs.snippet: Baby boomers say they want to stay in the work force past retirement age, a time that will coincide with increases in certain taxes and may cut into Social Security benefits.
